prompts:
Hi! I'm OPEBot, here to facilitate your team collaboration! We’ll wait 1 minute for more teammates to join. Feel free to chat in the meantime within this chat room.
Welcome to the online programming exercise! Let’s start with quick introductions. Please tell the team your name and an interesting fact about yourself, like your favorite hobby -- or, if you’re feeling like a guru, your favorite Python libraries. We’ll take 1 minute for this.|||Also, please feel free to ask each other questions and get to know one another!
Hi, [NAME]. Nice to meet you, [NAME]. Howdy, [NAME]. Hello, [NAME]. Whazup, [NAME]?
In this collaborative session, you will, as a team, engage in a data-driven debate, applying data exploration and visualization techniques to construct and defend a position on a debatable topic.
Starting now, you have 65 minutes to complete today’s activity, divided into three milestones. For each milestone, you’ll be assigned a group role, and roles will rotate at the end of each milestone. Let’s assign roles for Milestone 1!
NOTE: It is very important that ONLY ONE PERSON (THE DRIVER) EDIT THE CELL! If more than one person edits the cell, you risk losing your code!
It is now time to begin Milestone 1. You will have up to 25 minutes to complete this milestone.
When the time for this milestone runs out, the next milestone will automatically unlock. However, if your team finishes the current milestone (*** Milestone 1 ***) and would like to proceed to the next milestone EARLY, all team members must type the special word `ready` in the chat to unlock it.
When the time for this milestone runs out, the next milestone will automatically unlock. However, if your team finishes the current milestone (*** Milestone 2 ***) and would like to proceed to the next milestone EARLY, all team members must type the special word `ready` in the chat to unlock it.
Since this is the first milestone, let's take a few minutes to conduct an initial inspection of the dataset. Please complete the two collaborative tasks in the Jupyter Notebook. Discuss your first impressions with your team: Highlight what stands out, raise any questions, and consider how you might approach the data. Once everyone has shared their thoughts, proceed to identify and visualize data that supports the argument that EIPs were effective and equitable.
Now, it is time to begin Milestone 2. We will start off by reassigning roles!
Now, it is time to begin Milestone 3. We will start off by reassigning roles!
It is time to wrap up today's activity! Your team may continue analysis and interpretation later. Please run the cell in “Submit your code” to save your work and confirm that your work is uploaded to the Sail() platform.|||Thanks for participating in today's online programming exercise!|||Don't forget to run the cell in the "Submit your code" to save your team's work on the Sail() platform.
It's time for me to logoff. Bye!
[NAME1], for Milestone 1 you will be both the Navigator and Driver: Decide what visualization to implement; do the implementation; interpret the results; and record your findings in the chat.|||If someone joins late, have them assume the Researcher role and assist until the end of the current milestone.
[NAME1], for Milestone 1 you will be both the Navigator and Driver: Decide what visualization to implement; do the implementation; interpret the results; and record your findings in the chat. If someone joins late, have them assume the Researcher role and assist until the end of the current milestone.
For Milestone 1, you are assigned to the following roles: [ROLE1] - [NAME1], you will implement the code. [ROLE2] - [NAME2], you will lead the analysis by deciding what visualization to implement in the chat. You also need to interpret results and write down your findings in the chat. If someone joins late, have them assume the Researcher role and assist until the end of the current milestone.
For Milestone 1, you are assigned to the following roles: [ROLE1] - [NAME1], you will implement the code. [ROLE2] - [NAME2], you will lead the analysis by deciding what visualization to implement in the chat. You also need to interpret results and write down your findings in the chat. [ROLE3] - [NAME3], you will actively assist the Driver with implementation (e.g., searching library documentation). You will also review the Driver’s code and challenge the Navigator's interpretations to ensure accuracy.

Take a moment to preview the dataset. Start thinking about how the data might support different arguments. Discuss your first impressions with your team. Share what stands out, raise questions, and talk about how you might approach the data.
You may write and run some code to examine the dataset. Remember to avoid editing the same code cell simultaneously to prevent losing work. Coordinate in the chat to manage this.
That's all! Thanks for participating in this activity.
